description:
Google's projects, like our users, span the globe and require managers to keep the big picture in focus. As a Program Manager at Google, you lead complex, multi-disciplinary projects. You plan requirements with internal customers and usher projects through the entire project lifecycle. This includes managing project schedules, identifying risks and clearly communicating goals to project stakeholders. Your projects often span offices, time zones and hemispheres, and it's your job to keep all the players coordinated on the project's progress and deadlines.

Google’s Billing and Payments team is building a new Tax platform, all Google products (e.g. Play, Ads, YouTube, Cloud) leverage our billing platform and are in scope of this role.

As part of the Product Management team, you will bridge the technical and business worlds helping to deliver products that our customers love. You'll work with Engineering, Sales, Marketing, and Finance.

The Google Product Infrastructure (GPI) team at Google is responsible for building infrastructure that powers Google's flagship products across the globe. We provide the cohesive set of shared Google technologies - such as identity, payments, notifications, and accounts - that work consistently across our platforms and enable Google's product teams to continue creating excellent products for billions of people seamlessly.
eeo: At Google, we don’t just accept difference—we celebrate it, we support it, and we thrive on it for the benefit of our employees, our products and our community. Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing this form.
qualifications:
Minimum qualifications:

  • 5 years of experience managing financial system projects/programs.
  • 5 years of program management experience managing projects involving multiple teams/stakeholders, resource planning and budgeting/forecasting.

Preferred qualifications:

  • 8 years of experience working on managing financial transformations and/or revenue recognition system implementations.
  • Knowledge of reporting and data analysis for projects.
  • Ability to manage multiple stakeholders from different teams.
  • Developed influencing and communication skills.
responsibilities:
• Drive requirements and manage projects relating to the configuration of the billing platform for financial, tax and accounting functionality.
  • Manage documentation on existing accounting functionality on the payments platform for internal Google stakeholders including Finance, Integrators and Legal teams.
  • Work closely with cross functional teams including Product, Legal, Tax, Accounting and Operations.
  • Design and drive implementation of financial functionality on billing platform in collaboration with Engineering teams.
  • Conduct data analysis required to provide details on existing billing and accounting setup for projects to build/support business cases for development and management of finance/tax functionality on platform.
title: Program Manager, Financial Services
